DOC.brief_summary: Addition of systemic herbal immunomodulators with scaling & root planing (SRP) may enhance the therapeutic result of Chronic Periodontitis owing to host modulation & anti-inflammatory properties. If proven, herbal immunomodulators can be used as an adjunct to SRP.
DOC.brief_title: Role of Herbal Immunomodulators in the Treatment of Chronic Periodontitis
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients within age group of 30 to 55 years. 2. Systemically healthy individuals. 3. Patients with chronic generalized periodontitis (moderate and severe) according to Center of Disease Control (CDC) working group, 2007 criteria 1. Patients with systemic illnesses (i.e., diabetes mellitus, cancer, human immunodeficiency syndrome, bone metabolic diseases, or disorders that compromise wound healing, radiation, or immunosuppressive therapy), 2. Smoking, 3. Chronic alcoholics, 4. Pregnancy or lactation, 5. Use of NonSteroidal AntiInflammatory Drugs (NSAIDs), steroids or antibiotics / antimicrobials within January 2012 to Jun 2013, 6. Confirmed or suspected intolerance to herbal medicines, 7. Periodontal therapy done within the january 2012 to Jun 2013.
